title: Peter Brownie-led Stanton Road hires new MD
text:
Peter Brownie has hired a third managing director for his rapidly-growing boutique advisory firm Stanton Road Partners.

Street Talk understands Brownie has lured former colleague Max Keisers, who spent 10 years at Morgan Stanley before jumping to Luminis Partners.

Keisers worked on Bain Capital's $1.2 billion acquisition of MYOB while he was at Morgan Stanley, among other deals, and helped Adamantem Capital buy Legend Corp in May.

He lines up beside fellow MDs Brownie and Stephen Burns with more hires expected in the coming months.

Brownie left Luminis Partners 12 months ago and spent the previous two decades with bulge bracket investment banks Morgan Stanley and BZW/ABN Amro in Sydney. He set up Stanton Road earlier this year.

He's so far snared sell-side mandates for Quadrant's radiology business Qscan and Next Capital's fresh flowers marketer Lynch Group.
